decisions.decision: Shifted from mainnet to testnet mining due to impossibility of finding blocks with single GPU
decisions.speaker: Arohbe
decisions.context: Finding blocks with single GPU on mainnet would be virtually impossible
decisions.quote: So it did make a shift to testnet, had some complications, basically, syncing to testnet node

decisions.decision: Pivoted from testnet block mining to pool mining due to complications
decisions.speaker: Arohbe
decisions.context: Had complications connecting to testnet node and syncing
decisions.quote: Unfortunately, due to some complications, we did have to pivot to pool mining

decisions.decision: Hard-coded the miner to connect to Sigmanauts mining pool
decisions.speaker: Arohbe
decisions.context: Current pool configuration for the project
decisions.quote: Currently the code is basically hard-coded to connect to the Sigmanauts mining pool

commitments.commitment: All code will be available on GitHub and open for collaboration or modification
commitments.quote: All the code will be available on GitHub and open for collaboration or modification

commitments.commitment: Will revisit testnet node mining once it's more stable
commitments.quote: we can revisit that at a later time

commitments.commitment: Will continue to build out the project slowly
commitments.quote: something that personally I think I'll continue to build out slowly

open_questions.question: Job parsing and share submission functionality needs to be resolved
open_questions.context: Successfully connected to pool but having issues with share submission

open_questions.question: Overclocking automation implementation approach - Linux vs Windows vs BIOS modification
open_questions.context: Linux is not friendly with GPU settings, need alternative approach

key_facts.fact: Previously part of GetBlok team - a decentralized smart contract-based mining pool on Ergo that was closed
key_facts.speaker: Arohbe

key_facts.fact: Used AI to generate code, primarily GPT 4.1 with project folder method
key_facts.speaker: Arohbe

key_facts.fact: Used original Ergo CUDA miner developed by MHS as reference
key_facts.speaker: Arohbe

key_facts.fact: Architecture includes backend (Node.js/Express), frontend (React), Fast API, and CUDA miner
key_facts.speaker: Arohbe

key_facts.fact: Uses random forest machine learning model with decision tree method
key_facts.speaker: Arohbe

key_facts.fact: AI model currently uses five data points: temperature, utilization, power, nonce range, and difficulty
key_facts.speaker: Arohbe
